field.name: HIV-Positive Mother on ARVs | Ask and Take Action
How long have you been taking ARVs?
Do you have any problems with taking the drugs?
Explain to the mother the benefits of ARVs, both for the motherâ€™s health and for preventing infection to her baby
Counsel her to exclusively breastfeed her baby for 6 months
Refer to ART centre if mother is having problems taking drugs, if her ARVs are about to run out soon, or if baby is not taking ARVs
If mother and baby are on ARVs and are doing well, no need to refer now. Advise mother to visit ART centre for her next scheduled visit
Follow-up with the mother and baby after they have visited the ART centre, and again when the baby is 6 weeks old
